title.narrative: NATIONAL AND LOCAL PROTECTION SYSTEM

description.narrative: 3.2. Children have increased access to local protection systems., which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection Systems, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children and adolescents, especially the most disadvantaged, benefit from a violence-free environment, a child protection system that guarantees a quality and appropriate response, and a juvenile justice system in compliance with international standards.

mailing-address.narrative: Junín 1940 PB ¿ Ciudad Autónoma de Buenos Aires

related-activity.ref: 0240/A0/05/883 PR 3: PROTECTION & JUSTICE FOR CHILD & A

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.2. Children have increased access to local protection systems.

description.narrative: UNICEF contributed to strengthening the system for the protection of child rights, reaching normative, institutional and case management system milestones.UNICEF strengthened the child protection system achieving remarkable results, such as the implementation of the Case Management Information System (RUN) in 19 provinces, the evidence produce on the functioning of local CP system for their improvement and the development protocols for the helpline 102. CO advocated for the appointment of the Ombudsperson for child rights and strengthened the participation of adolescents on policies that affect them, achieving the inclusion of their recommendations in the CRC final report to the State. | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/08/2021
